topic_metadata.title: WebApp Git error: "Failed to push changes: There is a mismatch between file name and format"

posts.name: David
posts.cooked:
I am experiencing this (closed issue):

github.com/typst/webapp-issues

Cannot move/rename matlab source files: "There is a mismatch between file name and format"

opened 10:13AM - 22 Dec 23 UTC
closed 06:07PM - 14 Nov 24 UTC
ToxicMushroom
bug

### Description This is probably caused by some more general issue. In the lin…ked project you cannot rename `hello` to `hello.m` And you cannot move `hello.m` into the `folder` (Also breaks when trying to move a matlab file out of a folder) ### Reproduction URL https://typst.app/project/wgVrz1lPR9SUi1MGz6buGq ### Browsers Firefox ### OS Linux

github.com/typst/webapp-issues

"There is a mismatch between file name and format" error when pushing to git repo

opened 04:19AM - 23 Oct 24 UTC
closed 04:23PM - 15 Nov 24 UTC
peng1999
bug

### Description After writing the commit message and click "push" button, the e…rror occurs and refuse to proceed pushing. This is the layout of the repo: <img width="360" alt="image" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b915b2db-bdb2-4d20-bfca-494f7aec8535"> The `latex` folder is not used but I want to keep that. Is that cause a problem? ### Reproduction URL _No response_ ### Browsers Firefox ### OS macOS

I am not quite sure what to do. I only have .typ, .png, .jpg, .jpeg, .bib and .svg files in my project. Everything worked fine the day before yesterday, but I can neither push or pull using Git.

This is in the WebApp.

Screenshot 2025-05-30 160439376×1307 74.4 KB
posts.raw:
I am experiencing this (closed issue):
https://github.com/typst/webapp-issues/issues/244
https://github.com/typst/webapp-issues/issues/471

I am not quite sure what to do. I only have .typ, .png, .jpg, .jpeg, .bib and .svg files in my project. Everything worked fine the day before yesterday, but I can neither push or pull using Git.

This is in the WebApp.

posts.name: Konstantin
posts.cooked: I’m facing the exact same issue. I disconnected the repo, deleted the github repo and made a new one and reconnected which worked. Edited only one file and as I wanted to push or pull I got the same error message as you. This is very unfortunate as I just bought the pro plan to have the online and offline sync ability for my (soon due) thesis.
posts.raw: I'm facing the exact same issue. I disconnected the repo, deleted the github repo and made a new one and reconnected which worked. Edited only one file and as I wanted to push or pull I got the same error message as you. This is very unfortunate as I just bought the pro plan to have the online and offline sync ability for my (soon due) thesis.

posts.name: David
posts.cooked:
I am sorry to hear that!
I have not yet found a solution, and am still experiencing the problem.
(I am also in the exact same boat, having bought the pro plan to sync my bachelor’s thesis)
posts.raw:
I am sorry to hear that!
I have not yet found a solution, and am still experiencing the problem.

posts.name: AMendoza
posts.cooked: I am experiencing this error as well.
posts.raw: I am experiencing this error as well.

posts.name: Laurenz Mädje
posts.cooked: The problem should be fixed now. It was introduced on Friday in the course of fixing another bug. We apologize for the inconvenience.
posts.raw: The problem should be fixed now. It was introduced on Friday in the course of fixing another bug. We apologize for the inconvenience.

posts.name: David
posts.cooked:
Thank you. It seems fixed.

In the meantime, I’ve had to manually push my changes to GitHub (downloading the files). However, when I now tried to pull the changes from the WebApp, it presented me with some, what I guess are, merge conflicts. Even though I chose to keep all the Typst files (from the WebApp) multiple changes were made to my files, that looked a lot like some kind of corruption. Luckily, I had a backup and have restored it. If you are interested in the “corruption”: https://github.com/ETIMC/Report/commit/9009678c76e9137a592bf87857291c910cf1b312
posts.raw:
Thank you. It seems fixed.

In the meantime, I've had to manually push my changes to GitHub (downloading the files). However, when I now tried to pull the changes from the WebApp, it presented me with some, what I guess are, merge conflicts. Even though I chose to keep all the Typst files (from the WebApp) multiple changes were made to my files, that looked a lot like some kind of corruption. Luckily, I had a backup and have restored it. If you are interested in the "corruption": [https://github.com/ETIMC/Report/commit/9009678c76e9137a592bf87857291c910cf1b312](https://github.com/ETIMC/Report/commit/9009678c76e9137a592bf87857291c910cf1b312)

posts.name: Laurenz Mädje
posts.cooked: Thanks for the details and the backup branch, it will be useful in investigating that issue.
posts.raw: Thanks for the details and the backup branch, it will be useful in investigating that issue.

posts.name: Konstantin
posts.cooked: Thank you for fixing and the update! Works like a charm again now. Absolutely back in love with Typst <3
posts.raw: Thank you for fixing and the update! Works like a charm again now. Absolutely back in love with Typst <3
